goal_name: A society where the rule of law is consistently upheld, and access to timely justice is available to everyone
target_name: Strengthen links between traditional and formal justice systems and the role of chiefs in maintaining peace and stability
indicator_name: Proportion of population with positive assessment of their chief's ability to resolve disputes peacefully
GoalDescription: A society where the rule of law is consistently upheld, and access to timely justice is available to everyone
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Strengthen links between traditional and formal justice systems and the role of chiefs in maintaining peace and stability
IndicatorDescription: Proportion of population with positive assessment of their chief's ability to resolve disputes peacefully
ComputationMethod:
• Collect data through data request forms from Office of the Malvatumauri

•	 p = x / n
Where:
“x” is the number of items you’re interested in, and
“n” is the total number of items in the population
Note: While “p” is usually used as the symbol for the population proportion, you might also see the letter pi(π) used instead.
Concept: Proportion of population with positive assessment of their chief's ability to resolve disputes peacefully will be used to measure the strengths of links between traditional and formal justice systems with the role of chiefs in maintaining peace and stability
Definition: A defining characteristic of a chief is that he is ‘entitled to exercise powers of social control’ over members of his community (Paterson 2004)
IndicatorShortName: Assessment of Chiefs Role - Dispute Resolution
Rationale: To depict the level of ability of chiefs to resolve disputes peacefully through the positive assessments by the people in the communities.
source_organisation_1: 2012 Melanesian Well-being Indicators Pilot Study Report - VNSO
